name: Catalonia Plaza Cataluna

reviews.text: We arrived in Barcelona after a long flight only to find out that the a/c was broken in our previously booked hotel. We started making phone calls to find a new one and came across Duques de Bergara through pure luck. The lobby was grand and our room was spotless. Our a/c worked very well, the beds were super-comfy and our bathroom was all marble and very nice. We had a tiny balcony overlooking the entrance to the hotel and could see part of Placa Catalunya. We had a noise & light blocking door leading out to the balcony so the room was pitch black and silent while we were sleeping (maybe too much)! Location is very convenient too, not far from Las Ramblas and very close to transportation. The airport bus drops you very close by and is a bargain for 4 (or 5?) euros. Plus, El Corte Ingles in Placa Catalunya is my new favorite department store!
reviews.title: Great find

likes.liked: — cleanliness of room, convenient location, noise & light blocking door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are pretty well-traveled and have stayed at a variety of hotels, B&Bs, etc from -5-star to basic. This by far was the worst hotel experience we've had. We checked into a room with a smelly bathroom, and stinky tile floor. The room was overall pretty run down, with old, scratched up paint on the walls, and old furniture. We couldn't sleep because of the offensive smell. So we complained and asked to be moved. They first offered to clean our room, which did not help with the smell. The room we were moved to was even WORSE, and SMALLER in size. We rejected that, threatened to move out, and were offered a third room. When we lied down in bed, we discovered BUGS crawling all over us. We catapulted out of bed, and out of that hotel. Checked into a nice boutique hotel (same price) 3 blocks away, and finally enjoyed Barcelona.
reviews.title: Absolutely Disasterous

reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights to attend a conference - I was in room 527 at the front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a little small but had the benefit of a good sized balcony with table and chair great for chilling out, sunbathing enjoying a drink.
reviews.title: We just loved this hotel

likes.disliked: — The Internet connection is very expensive

reviews.text: No tea or coffee making facilities so if you fancy a drink take your own bottle opener and snacks! You could use the mini-bar in your room but I guess it's probably pretty expensive. The room has a decent bathroom with all you'd want. The room was serviced every day and left immaculate.
reviews.title: Perfect location for Barcelona tourism

likes.liked: — Central location with transport links, comfortable bed, spacious bathroom, pool and bar
likes.disliked: — Extra charge for lock to room safe, extremely overpriced internet station

reviews.text: Now I can't comment on value for money because I was staying as a guest of the "Barcelona Ocean Racing Foundation".
reviews.title: Don't understand the poor ratings - good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And maybe being hooked into a major Barcelona sporting event got me privileged treatment BUT
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was originally in a room overlooking the admittedly quiet street but asked for and got a room change to overlook the central courtyard - which was blissfully peaceful.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Location

reviews.text: The room was big enough, clean, comfortable and well equipped - although I didn't get the bathrobe and slippers that I had at the sister hotel (Catalonia Ramblas) previously.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay.
really convenient hotel
reviews.text: The breakfast was excellent. We drank in the bar - which was very quiet and where service had to be summoned by a bell. But the bartender was competent enough. My colleague reported that the dinner he had in the hotel restaurant was good.
Stayed there in July, it is not worth the money it costs ! In my room :
reviews.title: really bad service and definitely not worth it

reviews.text: - the floor was stained
reviews.title: Nice lobby and location Everything else not good

reviews.text: - the sheets had holes in them and were not really clean
reviews.title: 7 lad City Break

likes.disliked: — Restaurant didn't seem to be open

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - the phone wasn't working so I could not contact the room service
reviews.title: WORST BREAKFAST WORLDWIDE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - at the bar, I waited for 10 minutes but nobody came
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Having lived in Barcelona for six months, I knew this hotel was located in a very convenient location, less than 1/2 mile from Las Ramblas and Paseo de Gracia. The hotel is very nicely decorated and has a GREAT breakfast buffet. The staff is courteous and helpful if you need any information about restaurants, attractions, etc.
reviews.title: Great hotel in an ideal location

reviews.text: The hotel is a great value for the price.
reviews.title: A jewel in the heart of Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is right off the Catalonia square, but when you enter it is completely calm and quiet, and the atmosphere is very relaxed and friendly. The service is excellent. Apart from outstanding accommodation this hotel is excellent for all kinds of parties and conferences.
reviews.title: Excellent stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not on the rooming list on arrival but that was presumably the fault of Expedia! Having said that got a good room next to the suites on the 7th floor. Large comfortable bed, good bathroom with plenty of towels, changed daily. Very good buffet breakfast, so fill yer boots! Location is terrific and staff were very pleasant. Just don't recognise the bad reviews.
reviews.title: Bad service

reviews.text: The hotel foyer will give you a great impression, but for us it was all down hill from there. The hotel is run down by the standards set by its competitors at around the same price point, and the service is particularly lacking. Our room was shabby and had almost nil natural light. We packed up and moved across the road to The Pulitzer which was slightly more expensive but worlds apart in product and service.
reviews.title: Family fun in Barcelona

likes.liked: — Location and that it had and outside pool
likes.disliked: — The windows in the room dangerous for young children and pool was freezing ld

description: Hotel Catalonia Plaza Cataluña (previously Catalonia Duques de Bergara) is situated 50 metres from Barcelona’s Plaça Catalunya and is a 2-minute walk from Las Ramblas. It has an outdoor pool and free Wi-FiPlaza Cataluña Hotel is a 5-minute walk from Barcelona’s Gothic Quarter and a 20-minute walk from Barcelona Port. Gaudi’s Casa Batló and La Pedrera can be reached in around 15 minutes by foot.
